raw_comment:
1) I noticed that having a higher amount of income will still cost your chances of being admitted itself, but legacy does make a huge difference.

2) I wonder if there are other factors that play a huge role in college admission, apart from test scores and grades.

3) This relates to me because it gives me an idea of how I might stack up against other applicants of different demographics.   

4) "What Colleges Actually Look For"
ace_sentences: A higher income reduces the chances of admission.
Legacy status makes a huge difference in admission.
There are other factors in college admission.
Test scores are factors in college admission.
Grades are factors in college admission.
These other factors play a huge role in college admission.
This fact gives me an idea.
I might compare myself with other applicants.
Some other applicants have different demographics.
The headline is: What Colleges Actually Look For.
